repnme.cdata!:
Serbia and Montenegro - Privatization and
            Restructuring of Banks and Enterprises Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Privatization and
            Restructuring of Banks and Enterprises Technical Assistance
            Project for Serbia and Montenegro were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low
            or negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: importance of drawing lessons from other
            transition countries. the project design reflected best
            practice lessons from the Bank's prior operations in
            Europe and Central Asia, tailored to Serbian environment,
            and in Serbia. Technical assistance linkage to the
            Bank's policy reforms. Technical assistance in support
            of politically difficult transition reforms have a higher
            chance of success if designed as an integral part of the
            Bank's broader sector assistance strategy, supported at
            the policy level by relevant conditions in adjustment
            operation(s). Flexibility built into the technical
            assistance operations is essential when dealing with rapidly
            evolving operational environment, requiring adjustments in
            the project implementation to reflect the shifting policy priorities.

repnme.cdata!:
Yugoslavia, Federal Republic of -
            Privatization and Restructuring of Banks and Enterprises
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Privatization and Restructuring of
            Banks and Enterprises Technical Assistance Project aims to
            facilitate private sector-led economic growth in the Federal
            Republic of Yugoslavia (FRY) and the Republic of Serbia.
            There are two project components. The first launches and
            implements restructuring and privatization of large
            problematic socially-owned enteprises (SOEs); and the second
            component implements a comprehensive banking sector
            restructuring strategy aimed at creating a more viable
            financial sector. Specifically, the project establishes a
            consistent approach and methodology for the restructuring
            and subsequent privatization of large problematic SOEs;
            supports the restructuring and subsequent privatization of
            large loss-making enterprises by funding expert
            "restructuring agents" to prepare and implement
            "restructuring programs," privatize the saleable
            business units using internationally accepted transparent
            sales techniques, and put the unsaleable business units into
            bankruptcy; increase the capacity of the Privatization
            Agency to work with the restructuring agents to carry out
            the above-mentioned restructuring programs; and support the
            restructuring or liquidation of insolvent banks under the
            control of the Bank Rehabilitation Agency (BRA) and the
            privatization of most majority state-owned banks.
